00004 /* $Id: spmidi_print.h,v 1.16 2007/06/18 18:05:51 philjmsl Exp $ */
00021 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(MACOSX) || defined(LINUX) || defined(SPMIDI_USE_PRINTF)
00022 
00023         #include <stdio.h>
00024         #define PRTMSG( msg ) { printf( msg ); fflush( stdout ); }
00025         #define PRTNUMD( num ) { printf("%ld ", (long)(num)); fflush(stdout); }
00026         #define PRTNUMH( num ) { printf("0x%08lX ", (long)(num)); fflush(stdout); }
00027 
00028 #elif defined(SPMIDI_USE_PRINT)
00029 /* This is for custom platforms that use a special print() function. */
00030         #include <stdio.h>
00031         #define PRTMSG( msg ) { print( msg ); fflush( stdout ); }
00032         #define PRTNUMD( num ) { print("%ld ", (long)(num)); fflush(stdout); }
00033         #define PRTNUMH( num ) { print("0x%08lX ", (long)(num)); fflush(stdout); }
00034 
00035 #else
00036 
00037 #ifndef NULL
00038 /* NULL is normally defined in stdio.h so we define it here. */
00039         #define NULL ((void *) 0)
00040 #endif
00041 
00042         #ifdef SPMIDI_USE_DEBUG_TOOLS
00043 
00044                 #include "DebugTools.h"
00045                 #define PRTMSG( msg )  Debug_PrintString( msg )
00046                 #define PRTNUMD( num ) Debug_PrintDecimalNumber( num )
00047                 #define PRTNUMH( num ) Debug_PrintHexNumber( num )
00048 
00049         #else
00050                 /* Stub out all the print messages. */
00051                 #define PRTMSG( msg )
00052                 #define PRTNUMD( num )
00053                 #define PRTNUMH( num )
00054 
00055         #endif
00056 
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #define PRTMSGNUMD( msg, num ) { PRTMSG( msg ); PRTNUMD( num ); PRTMSG("\n"); }
00060 #define PRTMSGNUMH( msg, num ) { PRTMSG( msg ); PRTNUMH( num ); PRTMSG("\n"); }
